SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.gc31
Package it.polimi.ingsw.gc31.client_server.tcp

Class TCPClient

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc31.client_server.tcp.TCPClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
ClientCommands
public class TCPClient extends Object implements ClientCommands
Is the Client that uses the TCP paradigm to communicate with a Server, the connection is handled by a TCPServer. After the bind with the server a specific SocketClientHandler is created and associated with this TCPClient.

      Throws:

  • Method Details

    • tcp_sendCommand

      private void tcp_sendCommand(ServerQueueObject obj, String recipient)
      This method writes the object taken as parameter after setting the right recipient for it
      Parameters:
      obj - is the object that needs to be sent to the server
      recipient - is the controller or the gameController based on who has to execute the particular object

    • clientHandler_reader

      private void clientHandler_reader()
      This method checks continuously if there are object sent to the reader. If an object is found the method adds the object red in the callsList, after the object is added the method notify that an object has been added

    • executor

      private void executor()
      This method takes the object in the callsList (acquiring the lock) and invokes the execute method of the object. If there are no object in the list the thread wait for a new one

    • setUI

      public void setUI(UI ui)
      This method set the UI for the TCPClient
      Specified by:

      Parameters:
      ui - is the concrete UI that needs to be assigned for this TCPClient
      See Also:
      • TUI
      • GUI

    • setUsername

      public void setUsername(String username)
      Sets the username of the current user. To be used both when a reconnection is not detected and when a reconnection is refused
      Specified by:
      setUsername in interface ClientCommands
      Parameters:

    • setUsernameCall

      public void setUsernameCall(String username)
      This method is the first called by the client, it sends the client handler the request to execute the "connect" method. If the server has already this username an exception is launched
      Specified by:
      setUsernameCall in interface ClientCommands
      Parameters:
      username - is the username set by the client

      Specified by:

      Parameters:

    • joinGame

      public void joinGame(int gameId) throws RemoteException
      This method send the string that identifies the join game request made by the player
      Specified by:
      joinGame in interface ClientCommands
      Parameters:
      gameId - is the gameId of the particular game the player wants to join
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a generic connection error occurs

    • getGameList

      public void getGameList() throws NoGamesException
      This method should write on the user terminal the list of games already created Firstly it send to the client handler the request to execute the specified method. After that the method waits for the client handler's response, the response can be an exception (in this case the method launches the exception to the TUI) or the message "ok" otherwise. In this case the method reads every String sent by the client handler, collect every String in “list” and then call the method of the ui.
      Specified by:
      getGameList in interface ClientCommands
      Throws:
      NoGamesException - is launched if there are no created games

    • setReady

      public void setReady(boolean ready)
      This method sends to the server a new ReadyStatusObj object and the game controller as a recipient using the tcp_sendCommand method.
      Specified by:
      setReady in interface ClientCommands
      Parameters:
      ready - is the new ready value of the player

    • drawGold

      public void drawGold(int index) throws RemoteException
      This method sends to the server a new DrawGoldObj object and the game controller as a recipient using the tcp_sendCommand method

      index = 0 : drawing from the gold deck. index = 1 : drawing the first gold card on the board. index = 2 : drawing the second gold card on the board.

      Specified by:
      drawGold in interface ClientCommands
      Parameters:
      index - index=0 to draw from top of the deck. index=1,2 to draw card1,card2
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a generic connection error occurs

    • drawResource

      public void drawResource(int index) throws RemoteException
      This method sends to the server a new DrawResObj object and the game controller as a recipient using the tcp_sendCommand method.

      index = 0 : drawing from the resource deck. index = 1 : drawing the first resource card on the board. index = 2 : drawing the second resource card on the board.

      Specified by:
      drawResource in interface ClientCommands
      Parameters:
      index - index=0 to draw from top of the deck. index=1,2 to draw card1,card2
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a generic connection error occurs

      index = 0 : choose first secret objective card. index = 1 : choose second secret objective card.

    • startHeartBeat

      private void startHeartBeat()
      This method starts the procedure of the heart beat. It creates a task that is executed periodically. In particular every 5 seconds a HeartBeatObj is created and sent to the clientHandler with the specific recipient. The first execution is done at the invocation of this method, all the others execution are performed every 5 seconds

    • setToken

      public void setToken(int token, boolean temporary)
      This method set the token of the client to the value received by parameter
      Specified by:
      setToken in interface ClientCommands
      Parameters:
      token - is the value to be set as the token of the client
      temporary - indicates if the token to set is the temporary one or both of them.
      See Also:
      • Token
